News: Sen. Jeanne Shaheen (D-N.H.), fresh off her retirement announcement, is set to spearhead a major effort aimed at maximizing Ukraine’s leverage in the ongoing Trump-led peace talks with Russia.  The bipartisan push (Tillis/Graham among the R’s involved) will be modeled after CAATSA, the Russia sanctions bill the Senate passed 98-2 in 2017.  The goal is to strengthen that sanctions regime, codify sanctions that have been imposed via executive order since then, and, by extension, make it harder for Trump to lift sanctions on Russia as part of any peace deal.  The Graham-led portion would would lay out a series of sanctions that would be triggered if Russia re-invades Ukraine.
